title: 2021 Supercopa de España de Baloncesto
text:
The 2021 Supercopa de España de Baloncesto, also known as Supercopa <a href="Endesa">Endesa</a> for sponsorship reasons, was the 18th edition of the <a href="Supercopa%20de%20Espa%C3%B1a%20de%20Baloncesto">Supercopa de España de Baloncesto</a>, an annual <a href="basketball">basketball</a> competition for clubs in the <a href="Spanish%20basketball%20league%20system">Spanish basketball league system</a> that were successful in its major competitions in the preceding season.
<a href="Real%20Madrid%20Baloncesto">Real Madrid</a> defended successfully the title and conquered its fourth consecutive Supercup, 8th overall.
All times were in <a href="Western%20European%20Summer%20Time">Western European Summer Time</a> ()".
Qualification.
The tournament featured the winners from the three major competitions (<a href="2020%E2%80%9321%20ACB%20season">2020–21 Liga Endesa</a>, <a href="2021%20Copa%20del%20Rey%20de%20Baloncesto">2021 Copa del Rey</a> and <a href="2020%20Supercopa%20de%20Espa%C3%B1a%20de%20Baloncesto">2020 Supercopa Endesa</a>), the host team and the remaining highest ranked teams from the <a href="2020%E2%80%9321%20ACB%20season">2020–21 Liga Endesa</a> season if vacant berths exist.
Qualified teams.
The following four teams qualified for the tournament.
Venue.
On July 16, 2021, <a href="Asociaci%C3%B3n%20de%20Clubs%20de%20Baloncesto">ACB</a> selected and announced <a href="Tenerife">Tenerife</a> to host the <a href="super%20cup">supercup</a> on September 2021. The venue can hold 5,100 people for basketball games, and it offers 2,000 square meters of floor space. The facilities remain open all year long, without interruption. The pavilion also provides the following facilities for athletic use: 5 large locker rooms and 4 "double" locker rooms. Additionally, a gymnasium, infirmary, video and press room are available as well as a rehab room for athletes. The arena hosted the <a href="2017%20Basketball%20Champions%20League%20Final%20Four">2017 Champions League Final Four</a>, as <a href="CB%201939%20Canarias">Iberostar Tenerife</a> hosted the tournament in which Tenerife won its first Champions League title. The arena also hosted the <a href="2017%20FIBA%20Intercontinental%20Cup">2017 Intercontinental Cup</a> final match between Tenerife and <a href="Guaros%20de%20Lara%20%28basketball%29">Guaros de Lara</a>. The arena was also used a host venue of the <a href="2018%20FIBA%20Women%27s%20Basketball%20World%20Cup">2018 Women's World Cup</a>, and the <a href="2020%20FIBA%20Intercontinental%20Cup">2020 Intercontinental Cup</a>. The arena previously hosted the supercup in <a href="2020%20Supercopa%20de%20Espa%C3%B1a%20de%20Baloncesto">2020</a>.
Draw.
The draw was held on 17 August 2021. <a href="FC%20Barcelona%20B%C3%A0squet">Barça</a> as the league and cup champion and <a href="Real%20Madrid%20Baloncesto">Real Madrid</a> as supercup champion were the seeded teams.
